title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 ( S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Garda Síochána (Admissions and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Garda Síochána (Admissions and 

Appointments) (Amendment) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited garda siochana (admissions appointments) (amendment) regulation 2021

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 ( S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2013” means the Garda Síochána
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Regulations of 2013” means the Garda Síochána 

(Admissions and Appointments) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 470 of 2013).
text_norm: 2 regulation regulation 2013 mean garda siochana (admissions appointments) regulation 2013 (s.i no 470 2013)

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 ( S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 3. The Regulations of 2013 are amended in Regulation 4 -
text_raw:
3. The Regulations of 2013 are amended in Regulation 4 - 

(a) 

in paragraph (b)(i), by the substitution of the following clause for 
clause (II): 

“(II) is entitled under section 53, 56, 57 or 59 of the 
International Protection Act 2015 (No. 66 of 2015) to 
the rights and privileges specified in section 53 of that 
Act,”, 

(b) 

in paragraph (b)(ii), by the substitution of the following clause for 
clause (II): 

“(II) it consists of a period during which the person was 

entitled to remain in the State in accordance only 
with - 

(a) 

(b) 

section 9 (2) of the Refugee Act 1996 (No. 17 
of 1996), or 

section 16 of the International Protection Act 
2015 (No. 66 of 2015),” 

(c) 

in paragraph (c), by 
subparagraph for subparagraph (i): 

the substitution of 

the following 

“(i) a grade of not less than D3 or O6, as the case may be, in 5 
subjects at not lower than ordinary level in the Leaving 
Certificate Examination,”, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 4th January, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [757] 3 

(d) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (d): 

“(d) he or she is proficient in either or both of the following: 

(i) 

the Irish language; 

(ii) 

the English language.”. 

The Government hereby approve of the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

14 December, 2021. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

21 December, 2021. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [757]
